body_html: Hey, it works now. I the docker machine was running so it must have been network problem. I have a stupid question, so this time I run vdocker machine and typed docker run -it -p 8888:8888 gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow and the files I created the day before were missing. I'm pretty sure thats not the right way to open a new session, cause if it was then I am basically downloading it every time I start a session. Whats the right way to do it?

body: Hey, it works now. I the docker machine was running so it must have been network problem. I have a stupid question, so this time I run vdocker machine and typed docker run -it -p 8888:8888 gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow and the files I created the day before were missing. I'm pretty sure thats not the right way to open a new session, cause if it was then I am basically downloading it every time I start a session. Whats the right way to do it?
